Uses of Class
gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.numeric.PolarModel

Packages that use PolarModel
gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.classifier Provides classes to classify features of Equations and Data for the Solver. 
gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.numeric Provides classes to numerically model Equations and Data for the Solver. 
 

Uses of PolarModel in gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.classifier
 

Methods in gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.classifier that return PolarModel
 PolarModel PolarClassifier.getBestGuess()
          Returns the best guess at the polar model.
 

Uses of PolarModel in gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.numeric
 

Subclasses of PolarModel in gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.numeric
 class PolarConicModel
          The polar equation of a conic section is given by r = a/(1 - e*cos(\theta-\phi)) where a is the semi-major axis, e is the eccentricity, and \phi is the inclination of the semi-major axis.
 class PolarEnchiladaModel
          Includes features of all special cases -- the general equation is given by c0 + c1*r + c2/r + c3*r^2 + c4*cos(\theta) + c5*sin(\theta) + ... + c10*cos(4*\theta) + c11*sin(4*\theta) = 0
 class PolarLemniscateModel
          A lemniscate is the locus of points in the plane, the product of whose distances to two points located symmetrically about the origin is exactly the square of the distance of each point from the origin.
 class PolarLineModel
          The polar equation of a line is given by r = a/cos(\theta-\phi) where a is the length of a perpendicular from the origin to the line and \phi is the inclination of the perpendicular.
 class PolarRoseModel
          A polar "rose" is a curve formed by graphing an equation of the form r = a*cos(n*theta) or r = sin(n*theta).
 class PolarTrochoidModel
          Trochoids are curves traced by points fixed to circles which roll about other circles in the plane.
 

Methods in gov.nasa.ial.mde.solver.numeric that return PolarModel
 PolarModel[] PolarModelBuilder.getRankedModels()
          Returns the ranked models.
